items.title: Upgrade Next.js to the latest stable version
items.description:
Update Next.js from the current version (14.2.33) to the latest stable version available. This upgrade is a prerequisite for the redesign task to ensure the project uses the most current features and security patches.

**Requirements:**
- Check the latest stable Next.js version (use `npm view next version` or check nextjs.org)
- Update package.json to install the latest version
- Run `npm install` or `pnpm install` to update dependencies
- Review and update any deprecated APIs or breaking changes
- Ensure all existing functionality still works
- Test the dev server with `npm run dev`
- Verify the build succeeds with `npm run build`
- Run linter with `npm run lint` and fix any issues

**Notes:**
- Document any breaking changes encountered
- Update related dependencies if needed (e.g., react-dom, eslint-config-next)
- Keep TypeScript types in sync
acceptance_criteria: Next.js upgraded to the latest stable version
Dev server starts successfully with `npm run dev`
Production build succeeds with `npm run build`
No linting errors with `npm run lint`
All existing features still functional (CV editor, API routes, PDF generation)
No console errors or warnings in the browser

items.title: Redesign portfolio with minimalist monospace two-tone aesthetic
items.description:
Complete visual redesign of the portfolio site (me project) to achieve a minimalist, developer-focused aesthetic with the following specifications:

**Core Design Principles:**
1. **Monospace Typography**: Use monospace fonts throughout (e.g., JetBrains Mono, Fira Code, or similar) to appeal to developers
2. **Two-Tone Color Palette**: Strictly two colors - a dark tone (not pure black, e.g., #1a1a1a or #0f0f0f) and a light tone (not pure white, e.g., #f5f5f5 or #fafafa)
3. **Minimalist Layout**: Clean, uncluttered design with ample whitespace and clear visual hierarchy
4. **No Animations**: Remove all non-essential animations. If any animations exist, they must be extremely subtle and purposeful (e.g., simple fade-in on page load)

**Technical Requirements:**
- Update Tailwind config to use the new two-tone color palette
- Configure typography to use monospace fonts globally
- Remove or simplify all existing Three.js/3D elements unless absolutely necessary
- Remove framer-motion animations or replace with CSS transitions if absolutely needed
- Ensure all existing functionality remains intact (CV editing, API routes, etc.)
- Maintain responsive design principles
- Keep PostHog analytics working

**Deliverables:**
- Updated tailwind.config.ts with new color scheme and font settings
- Modified app/globals.css for new typography and color foundation
- Updated app/layout.tsx with monospace font configuration
- Redesigned app/page.tsx with minimalist two-tone aesthetic
- Any other components in src/ folder updated to match new design
- All existing features (CV editor, API endpoints) still functional

**Design Examples to Emulate:**
- Think: terminal/IDE aesthetic but modern and polished
- Inspiration: stripe.dev docs, GitHub's dark mode, Vercel's minimalist branding
- Emphasis on content over decoration, clarity over cleverness
acceptance_criteria: Site uses only two colors throughout (dark and light variants, not pure #000 and #fff)
All typography is monospace (including headings, body text, code snippets)
No animations except extremely subtle transitions (max 200ms, simple fade)
Three.js/3D elements removed or simplified to flat 2D equivalents
All existing functionality preserved (CV editor, API routes, PostHog)
Site builds successfully with `npm run build`
No linting errors with `npm run lint`
Responsive design maintained across desktop and mobile
